page.title: 14Leisure.
page.content: Although the area has only one village there are many ways to enjoy oneself. Tourists visit to climb the nearby Cheviot Hills, hang-glide, bird-watch, walk through the woods or go fishihg. They stay at the pub when it is open (currently closed for sale) and join locals for a game of darts, pool or something to eat. There are two fox- hunts in the region and game shooting. The village hall is well used for many activities and can be hired for dances and parties. There is a local cricket club with its own ground and a school field for children. Some people belong to football, rugby or tennis clubs in nearby towns. These places also offer a good range of evening classes. Some people prefer to stay at home to bake for the Church Fete or wayside stalls, to play instruments or watch television.
